config_defs.name: database.hostname
config_defs.documentation: The address of the Microsoft SQL Server.

config_defs.name: database.port
config_defs.documentation: Port number of the Microsoft SQL Server.

config_defs.name: database.user
config_defs.documentation: The name of the Microsoft SQL Server user that has the required authorization.

config_defs.name: database.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the Microsoft SQL Server user that has the required authorization.

config_defs.name: database.dbname
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?
config_defs.documentation: The name of the Microsoft SQL Server database to connect to.

config_defs.name: database.server.name
config_defs.documentation: The logical name of the Microsoft SQL Server cluster. This logical name forms a namespace and is used in all the names of the Kafka topics and the Kafka Connect schema names. The logical name is also used for the namespaces of the corresponding Avro schema, if Avro data format is used. Kafka topics should/will be created with the prefix ``database.server.name``. Only alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens and dots are allowed.

config_defs.name: database.instance
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?
config_defs.documentation: The name of the Microsoft SQL Server Instance

config_defs.name: database.applicationIntent
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?
config_defs.documentation: You can specify the keyword ApplicationIntent in your connection string. The assignable values are ReadWrite (the default) or ReadOnly

config_defs.name: database.history.skip.unparseable.ddl
config_defs.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector should ignore malformed or unknown database statements (`true`), or stop processing so a human can fix the issue (`false`). Defaults to `false`. Consider setting this to `true` to ignore unparseable statements.

config_defs.name: snapshot.mode
config_defs.documentation: A mode for taking an initial snapshot of the structure and optionally data of captured tables. Once the snapshot is complete, the connector will continue reading change events from the database’s redo logs. The default setting is ``initial``, and takes a snapshot of structure and data of captured tables; useful if topics should be populated with a complete representation of the data from the captured tables. The ``schema_only`` option takes a snapshot of the structure of captured tables only; useful if only changes happening from now onwards should be propagated to topics. The ``initial_only`` takes a snapshot of structure and data like initial but instead does not transition into streaming changes once the snapshot has completed.

config_defs.name: snapshot.isolation.mode
config_defs.documentation: A mode to control which transaction isolation level is used and how long the connector locks tables that are designated for capture. The snapshot, read_committed and read_uncommitted modes do not prevent other transactions from updating table rows during initial snapshot. The exclusive and repeatable_read modes do prevent concurrent updates.Mode choice also affects data consistency. Only exclusive and snapshot modes guarantee full consistency, that is, initial snapshot and streaming logs constitute a linear history. In case of repeatable_read and read_committed modes, it might happen that, for instance, a record added appears twice - once in initial snapshot and once in streaming phase. Nonetheless, that consistency level should do for data mirroring. For read_uncommitted there are no data consistency guarantees at all (some data might be lost or corrupted).

config_defs.name: signal.data.collection
config_defs.documentation: Fully-qualified name of the data collection that needs to be used to send signals to the connector. Use the following format to specify the fully-qualified collection name: ``databaseName.schemaName.tableName``

config_defs.name: database.history.store.only.captured.tables.ddl
config_defs.documentation:
A Boolean value that specifies whether the connector records schema structures from all tables in a schema or database, or only from tables that are designated for capture. Defaults to `false`. 
`false` - During a database snapshot, the connector records the schema data for all non-system tables in the database, including tables that are not designated for capture. It’s best to retain the default setting. If you later decide to capture changes from tables that you did not originally designate for capture, the connector can easily begin to capture data from those tables, because their schema structure is already stored in the schema history topic. 
`true` - During a database snapshot, the connector records the table schemas only for the tables from which Debezium captures change events. If you change the default value, and you later configure the connector to capture data from other tables in the database, the connector lacks the schema information that it requires to capture change events from the tables.

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: database.hostname
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?

config_defs.name: database.port
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?

config_defs.name: database.user
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?

config_defs.name: database.password
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?

config_defs.name: database.server.name
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your database?

config_defs.name: table.include.list
config_defs.documentation: An optional comma-separated list of strings that match fully-qualified table identifiers for tables to be monitored. Any table not included in this config property is excluded from monitoring. Each identifier is in the form ``schemaName.tableName``. By default the connector monitors every non-system table in each monitored schema. May not be used with "Table excluded".

config_defs.name: table.exclude.list
config_defs.documentation: An optional comma-separated list of strings that match fully-qualified table identifiers for tables to be excluded from monitoring. Any table not included in this config property is monitored. Each identifier is in the form ``schemaName.tableName``. May not be used with "Table included".

config_defs.name: tombstones.on.delete
config_defs.documentation: Controls whether a tombstone event should be generated after a delete event. When set to ``true``, the delete operations are represented by a delete event and a subsequent tombstone event. When set to ``false``, only a delete event is sent. Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key, once the source record got deleted.

config_defs.name: column.exclude.list
config_defs.documentation: Regular expressions matching columns to exclude from change events

config_defs.name: poll.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: Positive integer value that specifies the number of milliseconds the connector should wait during each iteration for new change events to appear. Defaults to 1000 milliseconds, or 1 second.

config_defs.name: max.batch.size
config_defs.documentation: Positive integer value that specifies the maximum size of each batch of events that should be processed during each iteration of this connector.

config_defs.name: event.processing.failure.handling.mode
config_defs.documentation: Specifies how the connector should react to exceptions during processing of binlog events.

config_defs.name: heartbeat.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: Controls how frequently the connector sends heartbeat messages to a Kafka topic. The behavior of default value 0 is that the connector does not send heartbeat messages.

config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, or JSON. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF.

config_defs.name: after.state.only
config_defs.documentation: Controls whether the generated Kafka record should contain only the state after applying change events.

config_defs.name: provide.transaction.metadata
config_defs.documentation: Stores transaction metadata information in a dedicated topic and enables the transaction metadata extraction together with event counting.

config_defs.name: decimal.handling.mode
config_defs.documentation: Specifies how DECIMAL and NUMERIC columns should be represented in change events, including: 'precise' (the default) uses java.math.BigDecimal to represent values, which are encoded in the change events using a binary representation and Kafka Connect's 'org.apache.kafka.connect.data.Decimal' type; 'string' uses string to represent values; 'double' represents values using Java's 'double', which may not offer the precision but will be far easier to use in consumers.

config_defs.name: binary.handling.mode
config_defs.documentation: Specifies how binary (blob, binary, etc.) columns should be represented in change events, including: 'bytes' (the default) represents binary data as byte array; 'base64' represents binary data as base64-encoded string; 'hex' represents binary data as hex-encoded (base16) string.

config_defs.name: time.precision.mode
config_defs.documentation: Time, date, and timestamps can be represented with different kinds of precisions, including: 'adaptive' (the default) bases the precision of time, date, and timestamp values on the database column's precision; 'adaptive_time_microseconds' like 'adaptive' mode, but TIME fields always use microseconds precision; 'connect' always represents time, date, and timestamp values using Kafka Connect's built-in representations for Time, Date, and Timestamp, which uses millisecond precision regardless of the database columns' precision.

config_defs.name: datatype.propagate.source.type
config_defs.display_name: Propagate Source Types by Data Type
config_defs.documentation: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching the database-specific data type names that adds the data type's original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.

config_defs.name: cleanup.policy
config_defs.documentation: Set the topic cleanup policy

config_defs.name: connector.class
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?

config_defs.name: name
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?
config_defs.documentation: Sets a name for your connector.

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: kafka.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode, whenever possible.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.key
config_defs.documentation: Kafka API Key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

connector_configs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
connector_configs.value: Placeholder value to pass connector validations

config_defs.name: kafka.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: The Service Account that will be used to generate the API keys to communicate with Kafka Cluster.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.secret
config_defs.documentation: Secret associated with Kafka API key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

config_defs.name: datapreview.schemas.enable
config_defs.display_name: Show schemas in data preview request output
config_defs.documentation:
This config key only applies to data preview requests and governs whether the data preview output has record schema with it.
The visibility condition is set such that it can never be true.
So this key does not show in create connector UI.

config_defs.name: errors.tolerance
config_defs.documentation: Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior. WARNING: This property should be used with CAUTION for SOURCE CONNECTORS as it may lead to dataloss. If you set this property to 'all', the connector will not fail on errant records, but will instead log them (and send to DLQ for Sink Connectors) and continue processing. If you set this property to 'none', the connector task will fail on errant records.

config_defs.name: producer.override.linger.ms
config_defs.documentation: The producer groups together any records that arrive in between request transmissions into a single batched request. More details can be found in the documentation: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/producer-configs.html#linger-ms.

config_defs.name: schema.context.name
config_defs.documentation: Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, or JSON. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF

config_defs.name: value.converter.schemas.enable
config_defs.documentation: Include schemas within each of the serialized values. Input messages must contain `schema` and `payload` fields and may not contain additional fields. For plain JSON data, set this to `false`. Applicable for JSON Converter.

config_defs.name: value.converter.replace.null.with.default
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Replace Null With Default
config_defs.documentation: Whether to replace fields that have a default value and that are null to the default value. When set to true, the default value is used, otherwise null is used. Applicable for JSON Converter.

config_defs.name: value.converter.ignore.default.for.nullables
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Ignore Default For Nullables
config_defs.documentation: When set to true, this property ensures that the corresponding record in Kafka is NULL, instead of showing the default column value. Applicable for AVRO,PROTOBUF and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.scrub.invalid.names
config_defs.documentation: Whether to scrub invalid names by replacing invalid characters with valid characters. Applicable for Avro and Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: output.key.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record key format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, PROTOBUF, STRING or JSON. Note that you need to have Confluent Cloud Schema Registry configured if using a schema-based message format like AVRO, JSON_SR, and PROTOBUF

config_defs.name: kafka.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode, whenever possible.

config_defs.name: auto.restart.on.user.error
config_defs.documentation: Enable connector to automatically restart on user-actionable errors.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.avro.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information and Enums. Applicable for Avro Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Enhanced Avro Schema Support

config_defs.name: value.converter.connect.meta.data
config_defs.documentation: Allow the Connect converter to add its metadata to the output schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.protobuf.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Enhanced Protobuf Schema Support

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.index.for.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate an index suffix for unions. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Generate Index For Unions

config_defs.name: value.converter.int.for.enums
config_defs.documentation: Whether to represent enums as integers. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should be specified with an optional label. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.struct.for.nulls
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate a struct variable for null values. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Generate Struct For Nulls

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should use primitive wrapper messages. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.raw.primitives
config_defs.documentation: Whether a wrapper message should be interpreted as a raw primitive at root level. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Wrapper For Raw Primitives

config_defs.name: value.converter.object.additional.properties
config_defs.documentation: Whether to allow additional properties for object schemas. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.optional.for.nonrequired
config_defs.documentation: Whether to set non-required properties to be optional. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Use Optional For Nonrequired

config_defs.name: value.converter.decimal.format
config_defs.documentation:
Specify the JSON/JSON_SR serialization format for Connect DECIMAL logical type values with two allowed literals:
BASE64 to serialize DECIMAL logical types as base64 encoded binary data and
NUMERIC to serialize Connect DECIMAL logical type values in JSON/JSON_SR as a number representing the decimal value.

config_defs.name: value.converter.auto.register.schemas
config_defs.documentation: Specify if the Serializer should attempt to register the Schema.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.latest.version
config_defs.documentation: Use latest version of schema in subject for serialization when auto.register.schemas is false.

config_defs.name: value.converter.latest.compatibility.strict
config_defs.documentation: Verify latest subject version is backward compatible when `use.latest.version` is `true`.

config_defs.name: key.converter.key.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: How to construct the subject name for key schema registration.
config_defs.display_name: Key Converter Key Subject Name Strategy

config_defs.name: value.converter.value.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how to construct the subject name under which the value schema is registered with Schema Registry.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Value Subject Name Strategy

config_defs.name: value.converter.reference.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Set the subject reference name strategy for value. Valid entries are DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy or QualifiedReferenceSubjectNameStrategy. Note that the subject reference name strategy can be selected only for PROTOBUF format with the default strategy being DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Reference Subject Name Strategy

config_defs.name: value.converter.allow.optional.map.keys
config_defs.documentation: Allow optional string map key when converting from Connect Schema to Avro Schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.
config_defs.display_name: Value Converter Allow Optional Map Keys

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.singleton.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten singleton unions. Applicable for Avro and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.proto2
config_defs.documentation: Whether proto2 optionals are supported. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten unions (oneofs). Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: header.converter
config_defs.documentation: The converter class for the headers. This is used to serialize and deserialize the headers of the messages.

config_defs.name: connector.egress.whitelist
config_defs.documentation: List a comma-separated list of FQDNs, IPs, or CIDR ranges for secure, restricted network egress.

config_defs.name: producer.override.compression.type
config_defs.documentation: The compression type for all data generated by the producer. Valid values are none, gzip, snappy, lz4, and zstd.
